CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using P1 as electron donor and solution - processable fullerene derivative PC61BM as electron acceptor , we fabricated bulk heterojunction OPV devices with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / P1 : PC61BM ( 1 : 1 , w / w ) / Al. Without any device optimization , the device afforded an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of 0.50 V , a short - circuit current density ( J sc ) of 1.42 mA / cm^2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 42.4% , and a preliminary power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 0.30% under an AM 1.5 simulated solar light at 100 mW / cm^2 ( Figure 7 ). The PCE is lower than that of poly[thiopheneimide-alt-benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b 0 ]dithiophene ] , 20-22 probably due to low hole mobility of P1 ( ca. 10^-6 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). ( LUMO ≈ -3.8 eV ) , 4 dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 - h ] We have designed and synthesized a new fused - ring building block , dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide. On the basis of this new building block , we have designed and synthesized a series of new conjugated copolymers containing electron - rich unit benzodithiophene or electron - deficient unit bithiazole or benzothiadiazole and homopolymers. The optical properties and HOMO / LUMO levels can be manipulated through adjusting copolymerized building blocks. Compared to homopolymer P6 , all copolymers P1-P5 exhibit red - shifted absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film and smaller bandgaps. Dithieno-[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide and its homopolymer exhibit low HOMO of -6.2 eV and relatively low LUMO of -3.1 eV , indicating that it is relatively weak n - type building block. Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO. Preliminary OPV results show that polymer solar cells based on P1 : PC61BM ( 1 : 1 , w / w ) gave a PCE of 0.30% under an AM 1.5 simulated solar light at 100 mW / cm^2. ' THF and toluene were distilled from sodium benzophenone under nitrogen prior to use. 3,4-Dibromofuran-2,5-dione ( 1 ) was synthesized according to the literature method. 41 4,8-Didodecyloxybenzodithiophene-2,6ditin and 4,4 0 -dihexyl-2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin were synthesized according to our published procedures. 47 Characterization. The 1 H and 13 °C NMR spectra were measured on a Bruker AVANCE 400 spectrometer. Mass spectra were measured on a GCT-MS micromass spectrometer using EI mode or on a Bruker Daltonics BIFLEX III MALDI - TOF Analyzer using MALDI mode. Elemental analyses were carried out using a FLASH EA1112 elemental analyzer. Solution ( chloroform ) and thin - film ( on quartz substrate ) UV-vis absorption spectra were recorded on a JASCO V-570 spectrophotometer. Solution ( CHCl 3 ) and thin - film ( on quartz substrate ) emission spectra were collected on a Hitachi F-4500 spectrofluorophotometer.

Let's think step by step.

1. P1 - an electron donor material in the OPV device
2. PC61BM - a solution-processable fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the OPV device
3. PEDOT : PSS - a material used as a hole transport layer in the OPV device
4. ITO - a material used as an anode in the OPV device
5. Al - a material used as a cathode in the OPV device
6. P6 - a homopolymer
7. Dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide - a new fused-ring building block
8. Benzodithiophene - an electron-rich unit in the copolymers
9. Bithiazole - an electron-deficient unit in the copolymers
10. Benzothiadiazole - an electron-deficient unit in the copolymers
11. THF - a solvent used in the synthesis of the polymers
12. Toluene - a solvent used in the synthesis of the polymers
13. Sodium benzophenone - a reagent used in the purification of the solvents
14. 3,4-Dibromofuran-2,5-dione - a reagent used in the synthesis of the polymers
15. 4,8-Didodecyloxybenzodithiophene-2,6ditin - a reagent used in the synthesis of the polymers
16. 4,4'-Dihexyl-2,2'-bithiazole-5,5'-ditin - a reagent used in the synthesis of the polymers

These are the identified "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using P1 as electron donor and solution - processable fullerene derivative PC61BM as electron acceptor , we fabricated bulk heterojunction OPV devices with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / P1 : PC61BM ( 1 : 1 , w / w ) / Al. Without any device optimization , the device afforded an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of 0.50 V , a short - circuit current density ( J sc ) of 1.42 mA / cm^2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 42.4% , and a preliminary power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 0.30% under an AM 1.5 simulated solar light at 100 mW / cm^2 ( Figure 7 ). The PCE is lower than that of poly[thiopheneimide-alt-benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b 0 ]dithiophene ] , 20-22 probably due to low hole mobility of P1 ( ca. 10^-6 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). ( LUMO ≈ -3.8 eV ) , 4 dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 - h ] We have designed and synthesized a new fused - ring building block , dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide. On the basis of this new building block , we have designed and synthesized a series of new conjugated copolymers containing electron - rich unit benzodithiophene or electron - deficient unit bithiazole or benzothiadiazole and homopolymers. The optical properties and HOMO / LUMO levels can be manipulated through adjusting copolymerized building blocks. Compared to homopolymer P6 , all copolymers P1-P5 exhibit red - shifted absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film and smaller bandgaps. Dithieno-[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide and its homopolymer exhibit low HOMO of -6.2 eV and relatively low LUMO of -3.1 eV , indicating that it is relatively weak n - type building block. Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO. Preliminary OPV results show that polymer solar cells based on P1 : PC61BM ( 1 : 1 , w / w ) gave a PCE of 0.30% under an AM 1.5 simulated solar light at 100 mW / cm^2. ' THF and toluene were distilled from sodium benzophenone under nitrogen prior to use. 3,4-Dibromofuran-2,5-dione ( 1 ) was synthesized according to the literature method. 41 4,8-Didodecyloxybenzodithiophene-2,6ditin and 4,4 0 -dihexyl-2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin were synthesized according to our published procedures. 47 Characterization. The 1 H and 13 °C NMR spectra were measured on a Bruker AVANCE 400 spectrometer. Mass spectra were measured on a GCT-MS micromass spectrometer using EI mode or on a Bruker Daltonics BIFLEX III MALDI - TOF Analyzer using MALDI mode. Elemental analyses were carried out using a FLASH EA1112 elemental analyzer. Solution ( chloroform ) and thin - film ( on quartz substrate ) UV-vis absorption spectra were recorded on a JASCO V-570 spectrophotometer. Solution ( CHCl 3 ) and thin - film ( on quartz substrate ) emission spectra were collected on a Hitachi F-4500 spectrofluorophotometer.

Let's think step by step.

1. P1: electron donor material
2. PC61BM: electron acceptor material
3. ITO: electron donor material (indium tin oxide, commonly used as a transparent electrode)
4. PEDOT:PSS: electron donor material (poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) polystyrene sulfonate, commonly used as a hole transport layer)
5. Al: electron acceptor material (aluminum, commonly used as a cathode)
6. P6: homopolymer material
7. Benzodithiophene: electron-rich unit in the copolymers
8. Bithiazole: electron-deficient unit in the copolymers
9. Benzothiadiazole: electron-deficient unit in the copolymers
10. THF: solvent material (tetrahydrofuran)
11. Toluene: solvent material
12. Sodium benzophenone: reducing agent used in the purification of THF and toluene
13. 3,4-Dibromofuran-2,5-dione: monomer material
14. 4,8-Didodecyloxybenzodithiophene-2,6-dithienyl: monomer material
15. 4,4'-Dihexyl-2,2'-bithiazole-5,5'-dithienyl: monomer material
16. Quartz substrate: material used for recording thin-film UV-vis absorption and emission spectra.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. P1: electron donor material
2. PC61BM: electron acceptor material
3. ITO: electron donor material
4. PEDOT:PSS: electron donor material
5. Al: electron acceptor material
6. P6: homopolymer material
7. Benzodithiophene: electron-rich unit in the copolymers
8. Bithiazole: electron-deficient unit in the copolymers
9. Benzothiadiazole: electron-deficient unit in the copolymers
10. THF: solvent material
11. Toluene: solvent material
12. 3,4-Dibromofuran-2,5-dione: monomer material
13. 4,8-Didodecyloxybenzodithiophene-2,6-dithienyl: monomer material
14. 4,4'-Dihexyl-2,2'-bithiazole-5,5'-dithienyl: monomer material
15. Quartz substrate: material used for recording thin-film UV-vis absorption and emission spectra.

Note: I have only included entities that are clearly related to the properties of materials, such as electron donor, electron acceptor, solvent, monomer, and substrate. I have excluded entities such as the NMR spectrometer, mass spectrometer, and elemental analyzer, as they are instruments used for characterizing materials rather than being properties of the materials themselves.

Paragraph: Using P1 as electron donor and solution - processable fullerene derivative PC61BM as electron acceptor , we fabricated bulk heterojunction OPV devices with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / P1 : PC61BM ( 1 : 1 , w / w ) / Al. Compared to homopolymer P6 , all copolymers P1-P5 exhibit red - shifted absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film and smaller bandgaps. Dithieno-[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide and its homopolymer exhibit low HOMO of -6.2 eV and relatively low LUMO of -3.1 eV , indicating that it is relatively weak n - type building block.
